sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with no solutions.
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations:

3x - 2y = 7

6x - 4y = 15

If there is no solution for the system, provide an explanation why not.
message_2:
First, we can simplify the second equation by dividing both sides by 2:

3x - 2y = 7.5

Now we have the following system of linear equations:

3x - 2y = 7
3x - 2y = 7.5

Notice that both equations have the same left side (3x - 2y) but different right sides (7 and 7.5). This means that the two lines are parallel and will never intersect. Therefore, there is no solution for this system of linear equations.
